l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a child you know who is very good at art. You should say:
Who the child is
How you know them
What kind of art they do
And explain why you think they are good at it.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I'd like to talk about my niece, who is incredibly Imaginative [富于想象力的]. She is truly Gifted [有天赋的] in painting and drawing. Because she is Observant [观察力敏锐的], she captures Expressive [表现力强的] details I often miss. Her room is often Messy [凌乱的] with paint, but she doesn't care. She was initially Reluctant [不情愿的] to show me her work because she was shy. Now, she is In one's element [如鱼得水] when drawing. I am Grateful [感激的] to see her Think outside the box [跳出框框思考] every day. She definitely has A hidden talent [隐藏的天赋] for art that will grow with time. I am very proud of her.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Child: Niece / Student
- Art: Paint / Draw
- Good: Color / Shape
- Why: Focus / Love

l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a creative person you admire. You should say:
Who they are
What they do
Why you admire them
And explain how they influence you.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I'm going to describe my art teacher, who is very Gifted [有天赋的]. She is always Imaginative [富于想象力的] and bold in her work. Since she taught me to Think outside the box [跳出框框思考], I am no longer Reluctant [不情愿的] to create. She is Observant [观察力敏锐的] of nature and people. Her studio is famously Messy [凌乱的] but incredibly inspiring [鼓舞人心的]. I am Grateful [感激的] for her Expressive [表现力强的] lessons. Watching her work, she is clearly In one's element [如鱼得水]. She helped me find A hidden talent [隐藏的天赋] inside myself that I never knew I had. She is a role model.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Person: Teacher / Friend
- Do: Write / Design
- Admire: Unique / Brave
- Influence [影响力]: Learn / Try

l1_part2_questions.question:
Describe a piece of art you like. You should say:
What it is
Where you saw it
What it looks like
And explain why you like it.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer:
I wish to talk about a sculpture I saw that was very Expressive [表现力强的]. It was made by a Gifted [有天赋的] artist who is very Imaginative [富于想象力的] with metal. Although the gallery was Messy [凌乱的], this piece stood out clearly. The artist was Observant [观察力敏锐的] of the human form. I was Reluctant [不情愿的] to leave it because it was so beautiful. I felt Grateful [感激的] to see someone Think outside the box [跳出框框思考] like that. The artist was clearly In one's element [如鱼得水] creating it, showing A hidden talent [隐藏的天赋] for sculpture. It was a truly memorable experience for me.

Brainstorming Ideas:
- Art: Statue / Pic
- Where: Park / Hall
- Look: Modern / Big
- Why: Feel / Think

l2_part3_questions.question: Is art important in education?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] From my perspective [观点/视角], it is vital for Cognitive [认知的] growth in all children. [Reason] It teaches students deep Appreciation [欣赏] of beauty and culture. [Example] Unless schools provide Inspiration [灵感], students will lack creative skills needed later in life. It helps them become seekers of Wisdom [智慧]. It is not just about drawing pictures in class, but about thinking differently.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Relaxing. Reason: Break. Example: Music class is fun.

l2_part3_questions.question: Can everyone be an artist?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] It seems to me that anyone can try, but few create a true Masterpiece [杰作]. [Reason] True art requires both immense skill and constant Inspiration [灵感]. [Example] While Beauty is in the eye of the beholder [情人眼里出西施], technical skill is often Objective [客观的]. Everyone can enjoy the process though. It is good for the soul to create something new.

l2_part3_questions.question: How does art influence culture?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] I believe it reflects our collective Wisdom [智慧] and shared history. [Reason] Art records the values and stories of a people for future generations. [Example] Since artists Paint a picture [描绘] of society, they help us understand ourselves better. It shapes our Aesthetic [审美的] taste deeply. It is a powerful cultural tool that unites us.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Identity. Reason: Pride. Example: National flags and songs.

l2_part3_questions.question: Why is abstract art difficult to understand?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] Unfortunately, many find it confusing [令人困惑的] because it lacks a clear subject or figure. [Reason] It relies on Aesthetic [审美的] feelings rather than simple logic. [Example] Even though it is a Masterpiece [杰作], it may not be Down to earth [务实的/接地气的] enough for everyone. It challenges our normal Cognitive [认知的] habits. You must feel it to understand it fully.

l2_part3_questions.question: Should government fund the arts?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] Unquestionably, yes. It supports public Appreciation [欣赏] of culture and history. [Reason] Without funds, many artists cannot find Inspiration [灵感] to work full time. [Example] Provided that money goes to Objective [客观的] projects, it benefits society greatly. Art makes cities beautiful and vibrant. It is a good investment for the future happiness of citizens. It is essential [基本的/必要的].
idea_suggestions: Opinion: Tourism. Reason: Museums. Example: People visit Paris for art.

l2_part3_questions.question: How has technology changed art?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: [Opinion] I think it has changed the Aesthetic [审美的] landscape completely for artists. [Reason] Digital tools offer new ways to create a Masterpiece [杰作] without paint or clay. [Example] Whereas painters used canvas, digital artists Paint a picture [描绘] on screens now. It expands Cognitive [认知的] possibilities for everyone. It is an exciting time for art innovation.
idea_suggestions: Opinion: 3D printing. Reason: New forms. Example: Making statues with machines.
